trend_summary: Built form stays largely constant, yet the southwest waterfront gains new mixed-use blocks and longer piers. Impervious lots near monuments shrink, while lawns and tree cover expand along the Mall and East Potomac Park. Overall pattern shows moderate infill paired with shoreline greening rather than wholesale urban sprawl.
notable_changes: Redevelopment of the southwest waterfront, replacing warehouses/parking with mid-rise mixed-use buildings and promenades.
Extension and re-configuration of marina piers south of the Tidal Basin.
Conversion of several Mall-side parking areas to lawn or landscaped plazas.
Growth of tree canopy and restored wetlands on East Potomac Parkâ€™s shorelines.
Minor road realignments and new pedestrian bridges near the Jefferson Memorial.
